etymologies: mid 16th century: so named because of the long spur on the fruit, thought to resemble a crane's beak

definitions: a herbaceous plant that typically has lobed leaves and purple, violet, or pink five-petaled flowers.

notes.text: Genus Geranium, family Geraniaceae: several species, including the common meadow cranesbill (G. pratense), with deeply toothed leaves and bluish-purple flowers

shortDefinitions: herbaceous plant which has lobed leaves
